document.masterDocTitle: New mite species of the genus Cunaxa (Acari: Prostigmata: Cunaxidae) from the Crimea, Ukraine

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New mite species of the genus Cunaxa (Acari: Prostigmata: Cunaxidae) from the Crimea, Ukraine

subSubSection.paragraph:
Gnathosoma (
Figs. 35–38
). Chaetotaxy and structure of palps (
Fig. 35
) and chelicerae (
Fig. 36
) as in
C. gordeevae
sp. nov.
Basi- and telofemur of palps with filiform dorsal setae, genu with incrassate dorsal setae. Apophysis of telofemur cone-like with dull apex, situated proximomedially on joint. Dorsally the hypognathal coxal region possesses an oval-shaped papillated area which joins with the broken striae of ventral surface of hypognathum (
Fig. 37
). Ventral surface of hypognathum as in
Fig. 38
.

Idiosomal dorsum (
Fig. 39
&
58
). Chaetotaxy as in
C. gordeevae
sp. nov.
Propodosomal plate mainly smooth, and only near the bases of setae vi and laterally to sce provided with some papillated regions. Also, the anterior region of the plate with faint striae (
Fig. 39
). Length of setae sci much longer than the half distance between their bases. Setae
f 1
and
h 1
distinctly setose. Relative length of dorsal hysterosomal setae:
f 1
=
h 1
˃
c 1
=
d 1
=
e 1
˃
c 2
. The hysterosomal dorsum with thin, long striae without lobes and papillae (
Fig. 58
).

Idiosomal venter (
Fig. 40
). Striae of the idiosomal venter are long, thin and smooth. Chaetotaxy as in
C. gordeevae
sp. nov.
Genital valves with longitudinal striae. Genital setae subequal in length. Distance between setae
g 2 –g 3
longer than distance
g 1 –g 2
and
g 3 –g 4
.

Legs (Fig. 41–44 ). Leg chaetotaxy: coxae I–IV, 3 sts , 1 peg — 1 sts — 3 sts — 2 sts ; trochanters I–IV, 1 — 1—2 — 1 sts ; basifemora I–IV, 4 — 4 — 3 —0 sts ; telofemora I–IV, 4 sts — 4 sts — 3 sts , 1 ms — 3 sts , 1 ms ; genua I–IV, { 2 asl , 1 sts }, { 2 asl }, 4 sts — 2 asl , 5 sts — 1 asl , 5 sts — 1 asl , 5 sts ; tibiae I–IV, { 1 asl , 1 sts }, 1 bsl , 4 sts — 1 bsl , 5 sts — 1 bsl , 5 sts — 1 T , 4 sts ; tarsi I–IV, { 1 bsl , 1 peo , 1 sts }, 3 bsl , 1 dtsl , 2 tsl , 21 sts — 1 bsl , 1 dtsl , 1 tsl , 22 ( 21 ) sts — 1 tsl , 22 ( 23 ) sts — 19 ( 20 ) sts . The surface of basifemora with transverse broken striae; that of other segments with elongate papillae which are dorsally longer and less dense than ventrally.
Remark . Number of simple setae on tarsi II–IV may vary between 22 – 21, 22–23 and 19–20 respectively.

Etymology. The specific name
violaphila
(from Latin: viola = violet, and Hellenic: phila = to like) refers to the distribution of this new species on the leaves of violets.

Differential diagnosis. See differential diagnosis of
Cunaxa yaylensis
sp. nov.

Biology. In laboratory on leaves of violet
Viola
sp.
C . violaphila
could ambush in web on tetranychid mites,
Tetranychus
sp.

Type material.
Female holotype , Ukraine , Crimea, “Cape Martyan” Nature Reserve, on leaves of violet
Viola sp
.
10 .X. 2008
(Coll. Khaustov, A.A.). Paratypes : 24 ΨΨ, with same date as holotype . 4 ΨΨ, in the same place,
8 .X. 2008
(Coll. Khaustov, A.A.). 5 ΨΨ, in the same place,
25 .XI. 2008
(Coll. Sergeyenko, A.L.). 8 ΨΨ, in the same place,
4 .XII. 2008
(Coll. Sergeyenko, A.L.).
Location of material. Holotype and 32 ΨΨ in NBG; 5 ΨΨ in SIZK ; 4 ΨΨ in ZMKU .
